message.content:
A Verbena hastata is a herbaceous plant native to North America.
It typically grows up to 1.5 meters in height and has several upright stems.
The leaves of the plant are lance-shaped and serrated along the edges, with a rough texture.
The flowers are small and tubular, clustered in spikes at the top of the stems.
They can range in color from light purple to blue or pink.
Verbena hastata is commonly used in herbal medicine for its digestive and calming properties.
It can be found growing in fields, meadows, and along roadsides throughout its native range.
